Truly awful game, killers are too over powered, imagine going into a game, getting knocked down on spawn and then not being able to play for the rest of the game because you cant recover fully without help. Then getting a matchmaking ban for leaving after everyone had already died, right before the game was over. Lovely right?

The game has been buggy for a longass time and their servers barely work but anyone who criticizes the developers gets banned on Discord and their posts removed from the forums and reddit.

The devs (the ones in their recent Q&A, anyway, including their lead) have very clearly shown themselves to not have played their own game nor give a fuck about what their playerbase says about any problems with the game, including cheaters. The fucked up SBMM pitting top ranks against baby players is intentional, according to them. 

Also, they don't know how to do basic math. 

There is no love put into this game. Lmao I hope it dies.

Honestly I was gonna make a joke but straight up don't buy this game. 2021 was the worst year ever for this game with every single update except for Hour of the Witch having massive gamebreaking issues on release while doing nothing to fix longstanding issues that have only gotten worse over time. Couple this with the extremely flawed MMR system they added and the continuous lack of communication from the out-of-touch devs and I can't see any reason to buy this game in its current state. Even on sale for $8 I wouldn't recommend this game since you basically need to buy $10-$20 worth of DLC to play it to its fullest extent.
Shallow fun. lazy, non-creative mechanics saturated in meaningless micro perks. you get trapped in a meaningless cycle of chasing temporary buff coupons.
muy buen juego pero no lo jueguen xD

Amazing game concept that can be Extremely fun given the exact right circumstances. In the past year or so, the developers have implemented changes as well as a matchmaking system that can sometimes combine to ruin the experience of the game for many players.

I would recommend picking this game up, but you should be warned, that there are glaring issues with this game that won't be apparent until you have put in a certain amount of time.

[b]The following is my subjective perception of the game and can be disputed. I am a killer main.[/b]

In my experience the matchmaking feels like it is divided into 4 or more chunks of players

[h1]Highest MMR: [/h1]
This consists of the best of the best (and cheaters).
Here you will generally see high level play and unique strategies from both survivors and killers.
Playing in this MMR bracket can make most games very exciting, this is what the game is balanced around, and this is where you will see peak excitement and skill.

[h1]Medium MMR:[/h1]
This consists of average to above average players.
This is where you will run into many TTVs and a large variety of players.
Games here are great a majority of the time, and teammates are generally consistent and team oriented.
Killers are generally serious and play generally well, but never crazy hard.
This is where you want to be, and generally where you could easily get as a new player

[h1]Noob MMR: [/h1]
This generally consists of Xbox gamepass players and other players just learning the game.
This is often where you will slip into after your first few losses, and where the MMR system fails to treat players well.
There is still hope for you, but pray you do not stay here too long, or slip too far down.
1 in 6 teammates will be afk during most of the match, and you may see your teammates wandering on the edge of the map not doing anything in particular.
Killers will often perform camping strategies, as they fail to understand how the scoring system works, or they just desperately want a couple sweet juicy kills. and more power to them, since your teammates will often jump into their chainsaw out of confusion or frustration.

 [h1]The Depths: [/h1]
This consists of very negligent players, and deliberate trolls.
Once you are here, you may never get out without finding hatches, or grouping with some friends.
Killers here will almost exclusively be crutching on cheesy strats or perks, and they can be nasty.
Here you will get many survivors playing and trolling in countless unreasonable ways. 
The trolls here seem to just want to ruin your day and keep you down there with them. If they aren't flat out teaming with the killer they will try to find other ways to sabotage the team.

toxic at times 
but i still can't stop playing it
Still the best in the field

cheaters, griefers, terrible "skill based" matchmaking. people just using OP builds of meta perks that take hundreds of hours to acquire, that a new player couldn't possibly hope to compete with using regular gameplay or skill. if you want to slowly grind away at the ability to infuriate others while being able to run around and ignore the mechanics of the game, this is the game for you.

Yeah since the new update I really feel like people have stopped playing. Survivor lobbies take more than 8 mins to get together and if you don't want to wait and decide to player killer you get matched against players way outside your skill level or players who can't do a totem. While being called an assortment of slurs in various languages after the match is over. I hate to say it but as decent as this game is and creative as the devs are I wouldn't recommend dbd even to my friends.

The developers do not care about it, it's been out for so many years and it's still unbalanced and just ends up frustrating you more than it letting you have fun. Its a great multi player game, the community is awesome. Sometimes multi player games are hard to play because other people don't pull their own weight, but this game does a good job of minimizing that. Team work is required but I haven't run into any horrid team mates.

This game gives mixed emotions. It once started back in 2016 as a game that I found very fun, could play alone, and would spend hours with my friends messing around and not taking the game seriously because that was the mood. 

As the years progress and the game grows the community quality as suffered. Important BHVR team members have left and the sense of it being a fun game is quickly dying with each update that tries to "polish" the game and make it more competitive friendly. 

I recommend the game because if you're a competitive type of person this game will be something you enjoy. Especially if you enjoy getting mad because the game has many bugs, exploits, and does not really try to balance the main issues but instead throws more licensed chapters at us and new cosmetics with paid rifts to milk us for money.
blight serum, with blighted skin on blight

Very poorly balanced game. DBD is only popular only because it's the only game of it's kind that takes itself somewhat serious. [b] Don't play killer, if you want to actually enjoy yourself![/b] Every survivor group you face will have a combination of of these perks Dead Hard, Decisive Strike, Circle of Healing, Borrowed Time, Lithe, Sprint Burst. And if you want to play survivor, enjoy 5+ minute queues most times since no one actually wants to play killer.
